title: Disconnected from champion select (client)
body:
Can this be looked at by Riot? Been going for 2+ years since the new client - I'm not the only one. Just google for "stuck at zero" or "champ select frozen" on the internet and there are dozens of posts. There's even YT videos showing this, reddit posts with 100+ comments, etc.

At the very least can you make the client pick the highlighted champion so we don't fail to select a champ and lose LP???

Edit: Don't ask for a trace or give me the generic networking troubleshooting guide. It doesn't work. There is something wrong with your client constantly d'cing when I NEVER d/c in game and internet is working during the champ select.

replies.body:
I know this isn't exactly what you wanted to hear, but the first step to troubleshooting these network issues is to first check your network settings to make sure you're able to get a clean connection to *our* servers (it's not uncommon to be able to connect to certain servers and not others, that's just how the internet works). 

Do me a favor and update your port forwarding and DNS settings really quickly following those steps in the [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues). This is a good way to force your network to send your connection in a very specific route to Google's servers first, then to ours. This typically helps with random ping spikes and such, but test this in a custom game and let me know how it helps.

>

> 
> Do me a favor and update your port forwarding and DNS settings really quickly following those steps in the [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues). This is a good way to force your network to send your connection in a very specific route to Google's servers first, then to ours. This typically helps with random ping spikes and such, but test this in a custom game and let me know how it helps.

I've changed the DNS settings to use Google's DNS. We'll see how it goes. I've already set up all the port forwarding on my router ages ago.
